definition: read-only (computing)
-ism/only/alone
yes
comma/phrase marked by pause
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: Arrays that are returned by properties are not write-protected, even if the property is read-only.
sentences.chinese: 即使屬性是唯讀，所傳回的陣列不會是寫入保護。

sentences.english: Enumerators provide read-only access to the data in a collection.
sentences.chinese: 列舉值提供對集合中資料的唯讀存取。

sentences.english: Describes how read-only information is displayed in the class diagram.
sentences.chinese: 說明唯讀資訊如何顯示在類別圖表中。

sentences.english: The calculated symbols are placed in a read-only symbols file.
sentences.chinese: 計算符號放置在唯讀符號檔內。

sentences.english: Specify whether the recordset is read-only or append-only.
sentences.chinese: 指定資料錄集是唯讀或僅能附加的。
該存檔檔案具有唯讀屬性。

sentences.english: The database classes support read-only joins but not updateable joins.
sentences.chinese: 資料錄類別支援唯讀聯結，而不支援可更新的聯結。

definition: shameful secret
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
(desired) effect/(expected) result/effective
compassion/empathetic
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
to prevail upon/to coax
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
written polemics
to scrutinize/to examine/to check
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
